description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the vulnerability identified as CVE-2024-5845 in Microsoft Edge, follow these steps:

1. Ensure your Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) browser is updated to version 126.0.6478.57 or later.
2. To check for updates, open your Microsoft Edge browser, click on the three dots (...) on the top right, select 'Help and feedback', then click on 'About Microsoft Edge'. This will display your current version and initiate an update if one is available.

**Details**:
- This update addresses a 'use after free' vulnerability in audio processing in Google Chrome, which could lead to potential exploitation via crafted files. It is critical to use at least version 126.0.6478.57 of Microsoft Edge, as older versions may be susceptible to this issue.
- Detailed update information can be found in the Microsoft Update guide at: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-5845.

**Preconditions**:
- Make sure that you are running a supported version of Microsoft Edge and allow the browser to update as necessary. Backup any important data prior to the update process. 
- Review the updated release notes on the security update guide for any additional instructions.
